Content-Type: text/plain;

For a moment, Tucson could see something in Convoy, that he had only seen i=
n Yoketron.  It was the gift of understanding even though he had done somet=
hing incorrect.  He smiles back to him and for the first time, feels relief=
 from inner torment that had burned in him for a long time.

" I promise, I=
'll keep it in check from now on. "

He gives a coy grin.

" Now, time to h=
ave a little fun.  By using sound at different intervals and frequencies, I=
 could easily confuse the guards into thinking that we are in opposite dire=
ctions from where we really are.  But I have to be in beast mode for that. =
 It's your call , Convoy, just give the word and I will execute my ploy."

=
Don't be envious of what you don't have, be grateful for things you already=
 posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends.

On Nov 7, 2011, a=
t 12:20 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
=
> > Tucson takes a deep breath and quickly begins to move. He was still
> >=
 festering with anger but he keeps from making any further noise.
> >
> > "=
 I know, not the best reaction at a time like this I'm working on it , but
=
> > it's not going to happen overnight. It's not like I didn't warn you tho=
ugh.
> > Be glad that didn't get taken out on anyone and just the wall. Goo=
d, by
> > now they got the message, that it's unwise to toil with a dragon'=
s temper."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> MACH KICK turned to TUSCON, obviously about to s=
ay something when BIG
> CONVOY laid a calming hand on his shoulder.
> 
> "S=
ave your anger for the enemy." CONVOY said calmly yet firmly. "We
> have a =
lot to do and we don't have time to deal with this."
> 
> "Bogies comming f=
rom your 6." Came a report from LONG RACK over their
> encrypted channel
> =

> BIG CONVOY nodded as he glanced to the side. "Come on, we've gotta
> go.=
" With that he turned and began running up one of the halls, MACH
> KICK an=
d BREAK, after a short pause quickly followed closely behind.
> 
> (TAG)
> =

> Preston
> 

--Apple-Mail-99-931053609

ack to him and for the first time, feels relief from inner torment that had=
 burned in him for a long time.</div><div><br></div><div>" I promise, I'll =
keep it in check from now on. "</div><div><br></div><div>He gives a coy gri=

g sound at different intervals and frequencies, I could easily confuse the =
guards into thinking that we are in opposite directions from where we reall=
y are.  But I have to be in beast mode for that.  It's your call =
